meanings.definition: To make a loud and confused noise, especially that of people shouting.
meanings.sent1: The children clamoured for attention during the school play.
meanings.sent2: The protesters clamoured for justice outside the courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys clamoured in the zoo, trying to outdo each other's calls.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds clamoured across the sky, heralding the approaching thunder.
meanings.sent5: The sirens clamoured in the distance, signaling the arrival of the fire trucks.

meanings.definition: To demand something loudly and insistently.
meanings.sent1: The fans clamoured for autographs after the concert.
meanings.sent2: The workers clamoured for higher wages at the union meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat clamoured for treats by meowing loudly at its owner.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock clamoured for attention, waking up the entire household.
meanings.sent5: The students clamoured for more time to complete their assignments before the deadline.
